name: Isomorphism problem of Coxeter groups
rephrased: Given two Coxeter diagrams, is it possible to determine if they represent the same abstract group?
posed_by: H.S.M. Coxeter (as a general problem in the field)
explained: The isomorphism problem for Coxeter groups is the question of determining whether two given Coxeter groups, defined by their Coxeter diagrams, are isomorphic as abstract groups. This means deciding if a structure-preserving, one-to-one, and onto mapping exists between their elements. It is a difficult problem, as different generating sets can describe the same group, and even groups with the same properties might not be isomorphic.
related_conjectures: twist conjecture for skew-angled and chordal Coxeter systems
